question.title: maven-replacer-plugin cannot find my Java source file
question.body:
I'd like to replace a version string in one of my Java source files by using maven-replacer-plugin. However, it seems not to be able to find my Java source file. What am I doing wrong?

pom.xml:

<plugin>
        <groupId>com.google.code.maven-replacer-plugin</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-replacer-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>1.3.2</version>
        <executions>
         <execution>
          <!-- the replace should happen before the app is compiled -->
          <phase>process-sources</phase>
          <goals>
           <goal>replace</goal>
          </goals>
         </execution>
        </executions>
    
        <configuration>
         <includes>
          <!-- replace the token in this file -->
          <include>${project.basedir}/src/main/java/com/jf/myapp/myclass.java</include>
         </includes>
         <!-- the name of the token to replace -->
         <token>$project_version$</token>
         <!-- replace it with the maven project version -->
         <value>${project.version}</value>
        </configuration>
       </plugin>

And in my Java source file (myclass.java):

public final static String appVersion = "$project_version$";

When I run a Maven install from Eclipse, the output shows this:

[INFO] 
[INFO] --- replacer:1.3.2:replace (default) @ myapp ---
[INFO]

question_comments.body: I followed @khmarbaise's suggestion, and used MANIFEST.MF file instead. It works perfectly!

A better approach is to follow khmarbaise's suggestion and use src/main/resources/version.properties instead and then add <resource> <directory>src/main/resources</directory> <filtering>true</filtering></resource> to the <build> section of your pom.xml.
Thanks @khmarbaise. I'm new to Maven and plugins and I followed what it seemed to me the easiest path. Good to know there are alternatives.
@life888888 Thanks a lot! That made the trick. If you post your comment as an answer, I'll accept it.

Why replacing something in your Java code instead of using a property file (src/main/resources/version.properties with filtering) or even using the MANIFEST.MF file instead.... Or if reqlly require that (which I doubt) I would suggest to take a look mojohaus.org/templating-maven-plugin

(1) change your code: <include>${project.basedir}/src/main/java/com/jf/myapp/mycla‌​ss.java</include> into <include>src/main/java/com/jf/myapp/myclass.java</include> (2) Add <regex>false</regex> before </configuration>.
